alert.note: Alert for Coke; Coleman; Concho; Fisher; Haskell; Jones; Kimble; Mason; McCulloch; Menard; Nolan; Runnels; Taylor; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Heat Advisory issued July 31 at 2:47PM CDT until July 31 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...HEAT ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING... ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM CDT TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Heat Advisory today, high temperatures this afternoon 102 to 106 degrees. For the Excessive Heat Warning Tuesday, high temperatures 104 to 107 degrees. * WHERE...Portions of west central Texas. * WHEN...For the Heat Advisory, until 8 PM CDT this evening. For the Excessive Heat Warning, from noon to 8 PM CDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Extreme heat will significantly increase the potential for heat related illnesses, particularly for those working or participating in outdoor activities.
info.instruction: Drink plenty of fluids, stay in an air-conditioned room, stay out of the sun, and check up on relatives and neighbors. Young children and pets should never be left unattended in vehicles under any circumstances. Take extra precautions if you work or spend time outside. When possible reschedule strenuous activities to early morning or evening. Know the signs and symptoms of heat exhaustion and heat stroke. Wear lightweight and loose fitting clothing when possible. To reduce risk during outdoor work, the Occupational Safety and Health Administration recommends scheduling frequent rest breaks in shaded or air conditioned environments. Anyone overcome by heat should be moved to a cool and shaded location. Heat stroke is an emergency! Call 9 1 1.
